I think the URL for the FAQ just got a little messed up, try:
 
http://craw=
ler.archive.org/faq.html#midfetch
 
The Q is: " I only want to download tex=
t/html and nothing else. Can I do
it?"
 
But I think you have got it half r=
ight.
Having it return true 'midfetch' what you want to get will cause the
=
HTTPFetcher to ignore everything else (if I'm reading the code right).
 
Si=
milarity your filter should return true for the material you WANT to write
=
to arcs in the ARCWriterProcessor. 
 
Generally, in the processing chain, i=
f a filter returns true, the URI is
'in.' So it's filtering stuff in, not o=
ut. The filters can then be set to
return true or false if the condition 'm=
atch' allowing you to flip it either
way.
 
- Kris
 

-----Original Message=
-----
From: robeger [mailto:reger@...] 
Sent: 2. desember 2004 15:20
=
To: archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [archive-crawler] Re: ContentT=
ypeRegExFilter



I had found the user manual pages, but not the FAQ questi=
on about it.
So at the midfetch stage I want to set it to return true for t=
he
content-types I want to fetch, and at the ARC writer stage I want to
set=
 it to return true for ones I don't want written to the ARC (which
at this =
point would just be the response headers).  Is that correct?

Thanks,
Rob.
=

to match the

> 
> Depends on =
where you're trying to set the filter.
>

h on the ContentTypeRegExpFilter if 
> content-type filtering is your thing=
: 
> http://crawler.archive.org/articles/user_manual.html#filters -- see

 6.3.2.3. org.archive.crawler.filter.ContentTypeRegExpFilter (There is
